qst-child-parent-introduction: Understanding the impact of your child’s illness and treatments on his or her everyday life can help your healthcare team keep track of your child’s health and adjust his or her treatments. For this reason, we have developed a quality of life questionnaire specifically for parents of children with cystic fibrosis. We thank you for your willingness to complete this questionnaire.
qst-child-parent-instructions: The following questions are about the current state of your child’s health, as he or she perceives it. This information will allow us to better understand how he or she feels in everyday life. Please answer all the questions. There are no right or wrong answers! If you are not sure how to answer, choose the response that seems closest to your child's situation.
qst-child-parent-section-demographic-int: Please fill in the information or check the box indicating your answer.
qst-child-parent-question-birth: What's your child's date of birth?
qst-child-parent-question-relationship: What is your relationship to the child?
qst-child-parent-question-race: Which of the following best describes your child's racial or ethnic background?
qst-child-parent-answer-race-g: Prefere not to answer this question
qst-child-parent-question-vacation: During the past two weeks, has your child been on vacation or our of school for reasons NOT related to his or her health?
qst-child-parent-question-birthparent: What is your date of birth?
qst-child-parent-question-marital: What is your current marital status?
qst-child-parent-question-school: What is the highest grade in school you have completed
qst-child-parent-question-work: Which of the following best describes your current work status
qst-child-parent-answer-work-b: Working full or part time (either outside the home or at a home-based business)
qst-child-parent-answer-work-d: Not working due to my health
qst-child-parent-section-qualityoflife-i: Please indicate how your child has been feeling during the past two weeks by checking the box matching your response.
qst-child-parent-group-a: To what extent has your child had difficulty:
qst-child-parent-question-1: Performing vigorous activities such as running or playing sports
qst-child-parent-question-3: Climbing stairs as fast as others
qst-child-parent-question-4: Carrying or lifting heavy objects such as books, school bag, or backpack
qst-child-parent-group-b: During the past two weeks, indicate how often your child:
qst-child-parent-question-13: Was absent or late for school or other activites because of his/her illness or treatments
qst-child-parent-section-qualityoflife-s: Thinking about the state of your child’s health over the past two weeks, indicate:
qst-child-parent-question-14: The extent to which your child participated in sports and other physical activities, such as gym class
qst-child-parent-answer-14-a: Has not participated in physical activities
qst-child-parent-answer-14-b: Has participated less than usual in sports
qst-child-parent-answer-14-c: Has participated as much as usual but with some difficulty
qst-child-parent-answer-14-d: Has been able to participate in physical activities without any difficulty
qst-child-parent-question-15: The extent to which your child has difficulty walking
qst-child-parent-answer-15-a: He or she can walk a long time without getting tired
qst-child-parent-answer-15-b: He or she can walk a long time but gets tired
qst-child-parent-answer-15-c: He or she cannot walk a long time, because he or she gets tired quickly
qst-child-parent-answer-15-d: He or she avoids walking whenever possible, because it’s too tiring for him or her
qst-child-parent-group-c: Thinking about your child’s state of health during the past two weeks, indicate the extent to which each sentence is true or false for your child:
qst-child-parent-question-16: My child has trouble recovering after physical effort
qst-child-parent-question-18: My child’s treatments get in the way of his/her activities
qst-child-parent-question-19: My child feels small compared to other kids the same age
qst-child-parent-question-20: My child feels physically different from other kids the same age
qst-child-parent-question-21: My child thinks that he/she is too thin
qst-child-parent-question-23: My child tends to be withdrawn
qst-child-parent-question-24: My child leads a normal life
qst-child-parent-question-25: My child has less fun than usual
qst-child-parent-question-26: My child has trouble getting along with others
qst-child-parent-question-28: My child is able to keep up with his/her school work or summer activities (e.g.camp)
qst-child-parent-question-29: My child is not doing as well as usual in school or summer activities (e.g. camp)
qst-child-parent-question-30: My child spends a lot of time on his/her treatments everyday
qst-child-parent-question-31: How difficult is it for your child to do his/her treatments (including medications) each day?
qst-child-parent-question-32: How do you think your child’s health is now?
qst-child-parent-section-symptoms-introd: The next set of questions is designed to determine the frequency with which your child has certain respiratory difficulties, such as coughing or shortness of breath.
qst-child-parent-group-d: Thinking about your child’s state of health during the past two weeks, indicate the extent to which each sentence is true or false for your child:
qst-child-parent-question-33: My child had trouble gaining weight
qst-child-parent-question-34: My child was congested in his/her chest
qst-child-parent-question-35: My child coughed during the day
qst-child-parent-question-36: My child had to cough up mucus
qst-child-parent-question-37: My child’s mucus has been mostly:
qst-child-parent-question-40: My child woke up during the night because he/she was coughing
qst-child-parent-question-44: My child has had eating problems
qst-child-parent-question-45: My child forgot to take his/her enzymes
qst-child-parent-question-47: My child has had acid reflux
qst-child-parent-question-49: My child has had trouble with his/her g-tube/MICKEY tube
qst-child-parent-question-50: My child has had to use the bathroom frequently (bowel movements)
qst-child-parent-question-51: My child has had a stuffy nose
qst-child-parent-question-52: My child has had sinus headaches
qst-child-parent-question-53: My child has had post-nasal drip
qst-child-parent-question-54: My child has had facial pain
qst-child-parent-question-55: My child has had pressure in his/her ears
